response.answer_text: The context of your question is not clear to me so will try to address some possibilities. Objectivity is usually defined as: “External or material reality.”Subjectivity is usually defined as: “The private, arbitrary, and limited element of self; that which is peculiar to an individual mind: as, the subjectivity of Byron or Shelley.” In that sense, I consider subjectivity to be subordinate to, or biased representation of objectivity. I recognize that doesn’t work perfectly in all uses but believe it to be a useful expression. It occurs to me that you might be asking about the roles of objectivity and subjectivity within one’s individual thinking and that may be almost the opposite if one considers them as parts of a process. If we agree that one’s impression of reality outside of one’s own mind is subjective, subject to one’s own filtering, imperfect perceptions, then I believe it to be useful to conceive that we begin our life experience completely within the subjective. Over time our subjective impressions confront reality in which the inaccuracies of our subjective impressions impact with reality/the objective. Over time we begin to appreciate if only because of the consequences, that our impressions, our model of reality, is subjective, inaccurate, and that it has utility to attempt to reduce our subjectivity towards the objective. In that sense, I believe it to be accurate to say that our (personal) subjectivity (of experience) does create (a value for/appreciation of) reality. This was just a “type & post” without even rereading so not as polished as might like but hope it offers something of value. Are either of these responses able to address your question?

object is anything which isn’t your self-sense. self-sense gets a pass as object, doesn’t cause a physical reaction. subject is created when the senses fill and express as urgency. the subject looks for an object. ‘objectivity’ is just this search for an object. it’s not a submarine cable to your inner child. it leaves the child behind and goes hunting. so, to have an object to flavor reality as objective, you need a self to create a subject for the beginning of the organization of thought-ness. objective and subject have no content.

I’ll be bold and theoretical here: Yes, in the sense that all objectivity is really only “group consensus” subjectivity. There is no “proof” of anything beyond manmade* observations along with manmade theories and manmade experiments, even using manmade sensors. *: ladies included I’m betting I might get some lively replies here. :)

Some times, subjectivity is objectivity. With humans, it’s a very difficult concept, because we see so much diversion in so many subjects. Politics and religion are the two major ones. Most people are 100% sure they are correct.
Yes. Forms of mesurement and documentation are created by subjects and allow to exist objective statements on reality

I think they wrestle each other for the 51/49 split advantage when when it comes to interpretation over which came first. There's no clear cut winner on this one. They both could lead. Answer: 1 objectivity 2 subjectivity = sobjectivity.
